alert.note: Alert for Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 11:02AM CDT until May 22 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Zapata. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1102 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Zapata, Bustamante, Medina, Zapata County Airport, Las Palmas, Zapata High School, Zapata Middle School, Falcon Shores, Zapata County Fire Department, Zapata County Public Library, Falcon Lake Estates, Siesta Shores, Falcon Mesa, Morales-Sanchez, Romeo T. Flores Park, Zapata--Medina and Black Bass. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
